column8: IDvK5I3bz8kThe Permatang Pauh PAS division in Penang has severed ties with PKR.The division delegates unanimously passed a motion to sever ties with the party at its 40th annual general meeting (AGM) here yesterday.Some 200 delegates attended the meeting at Dewan Haji Yusof Ar Rawa.The decision is a blow to PKR president Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail as she is the Permatang Pauh MP.To compound matters, division chief Omar Hassan said PAS would field candidates in Permatang Pauh and all the three states in the parliamentary constituency in the next general election.Two of the state seats – Seberang Jaya and Penanti – are held by PKR while the remaining one is the sole state seat in Penang which PAS holds.Omar said the motion to sever ties with PKR was brought by the division’s Women and Youth wings, and the Permatang Tok Kandu branch.He said the division was disappointed with PKR’s lack of respect for PAS as a political partner when it continued to cooperate with the DAP and Parti Amanah Negara which had attacked the PAS leadership.He claimed that PKR had used a number of PAS members for their own political interests without discussing first with the PAS leadership.“There were also complaints from PAS members that PKR had asked them to quit PAS and join PKR in order to hold specific positions in the state government,” Omar told a press conference after the AGM.Also present were PAS central committee member Datuk Dr Mohd Khairuddin Aman Razali and Permatang Pauh PAS deputy chief Amir Hamzah Hashim.Omar also made a few other allegations against PKR, including those involving fatwas.He said PAS had about 30 branches and almost 5,000 members in Permatang Pauh which he claimed were more than that of PKR.Penang PKR chief Datuk Mansor Othman could not be reached for comments.In Petaling Jaya, a senior PAS leader said PAS and Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Pribumi) can still forge a separate deal to cooperate despite Pribumi’s interest to join Pakatan Harapan.This is despite PAS’ position that it will not work with DAP and Amanah, the two parties which along with PKR make up the Pakatan Harapan Opposition grouping.PAS secretary-general Datuk Takiyuddin Hassan said there was still a flicker of hope for PAS and Pribumi to forge a cooperation and share common goals.“Although we know that Pribumi has shown interest in joining Pakatan Harapan, it does not mean that PAS cannot have a separate deal with Pribumi.“We cannot just write off this effort by PAS and Pribumi to come up with something for our common good.“Despite the recent developments that may make this effort seem doomed, I still feel PAS can still strike a deal with Pribumi no matter how pessimistic the situation is,” he said.Takiyuddin was of the view that PAS could afford to be vindictive just because Pribumi was in cahoots with DAP and Amanah.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...SPW2LypllfX0.99
